intro: Canthium dictyophlebum, commonly known as the African hogweed, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its large, palmate leaves and showy, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its fruits are follicles that contain seeds with a tuft of silky hairs, aiding in wind dispersal. The plant is often found in disturbed soils and is adapted to thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
